intro: Anemone jankae, commonly known as the Jankae anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy flowering plants. The plant features basal leaves that are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, and it produces delicate, white or pale pink flowers with five petals. Anemone jankae typically blooms in late spring to early summer, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
